headline: Slow Cooker Venison Roast
description: This venison roast crockpot dinner couldn't be easier: Venison, onion, and 2 soup mixes simmer in the slow cooker for a creamy, tender, delectable meal.

video.description: A simple, delicious way to enjoy venison with lots of flavorful gravy.
video.name: Slow Cooker Venison Roast

name: Slow Cooker Venison Roast
recipeIngredient: 1 (1 ounce) package dry onion soup mix
1 (10.75 ounce) can condensed cream of mushroom soup

recipeInstructions.text: Clean venison roast and place in a slow cooker. Cover with onion slices, then sprinkle with soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce, garlic salt, and pepper.
Stir onion soup mix and condensed soup together in a small bowl. Pour mixture over venison.
Cover and cook on Low setting for 6 hours.

review.reviewBody: I want to make this again, but the combination of 1TBS of garlic salt plus the dry soup mix made this way too salty. Next time I will eliminate the garlic salt all together and just add minced garlic.

My venison roast was just right size (3lbs ) but I flipped the roast itself over about 4 hrs in. No real reason just wanted to see what happen because top side wasn’t submerged. Not sure it helped but I did it lol. I added carrots and potatoes. Awesome simple recipe.

This would have been a 5 if it wasn’t so salty. We’re a family who typically over seasons stuff too so i really didn’t think it was going to be that bad. I wish I read the other reviews before making it. The venison def cooked really well and the flavor would have been perfect had it not been SO SALTY.
Awesome recipe. A tad bit on the salty side but still outrageous.
Really great recipe. I left out the cream soup so that I could make gravy with the Au Jus to serve over mashed potatoes. It was a phenomenal meal.

There are pros and cons to this recipe. You definitely need to tweak it, and add some things to it. The only things I changed was I added a 1/2 cup of water, and 3 chopped potatoes. I cooked it for 6 hours and the roast was tough, so I will be doing 5 hours next time. The flavor is absolutely delicious though! This recipe called for way to much onion in my opinion. It gave my husband and I extremely upset stomachs the next day. It was also very salty, but we didn’t mind it. Now that I’ve made this I know how to change it up next time to make it better. Like I previously mentioned though, the flavor is delicious!

This is a great starter recipe for any roast, very simple. After you try it you can mix and match or add other ingredients that suit your personal taste. 
Anyone else notice what’s missing from the ingredients list? Hint- you can find it in the picture! I pulled up a recipe to see if I was missing something basic, sure enough I forgot the garlic salt!
2 large baking potatoes work for me or sometimes I use red potatoes, while.

I followed directions and it was a little bland! I'm not sure what I did wrong. I have another roast in the freezer. I'm going to try the exact recipe again and see what happens. I'll update after trying again.

Excellent. Makes really good gravy. I used garlic powder instead of garlic salt. It would be too salty with that much garlic salt. Hubby doesn't like mushrooms and he gobbled it up and also thought it was beef.
I used Cream of Celery soup and regular garlic, it came out so yummy
Oh... my.... gawd, this is hands down the best venison recipe ever. Sooooo good. Putting my favorites.
Love this recipe!! I had an oops and didn’t have dry onion soup mix, but the Lipton savory herbs mix, so I gave it a whirl. It was amazing!!
Yum!!! I put venison and pork shoulder. Added in small potatoes and carrots.

Was so hopeful but it was terrible. All flavor of the venison was gone. What was left was akin to cardboard. The only edible portion was the fairly good broth and veggies I added. And I had so carefully trimmed the meat. A LOT of wasted time. Don’t waste yours.
Was very good as listed. I would make it again. I served it with or over mash potatoes.
I add carrots and celery. Garlic power instead of salt.
Absolutely fall of the bone yummy! Easy and tasty.
Made it according to recipe...hubby loved it!! Making it again today for him!!!
Easy and delish!
good recipe but too salty. made it a second time without the onion soup and garlic salt, salt was gone but lost some flavor too, but overall better. May try 1/2 of the onion soup next time
Substituted real garlic instead of garlic salt, like somebody else suggested in the reviews. It turned out super delicious. My family loved it! I’ve made it twice so far!

I have been using this recipe for years. I use it for roast from any animal. We absolutely love it and every guest that has ever tried it at my house agrees that it is delicious. The only thing I do that is not listed in the recipe is add vegetables. I quarter an onion, cut carrots to a length of about 3" and add any potato I have laying around cut into quarters. I add all of this to the slow cooker so my sides are already done with the meat is cooked. The juices from the meat give the vegetables a fantastic flavor. When adding the vegetables I add enough to feed however many people will be sitting at my table that night. I usually put the vegetables under the roast so when the juice drip off the roast it fully coats the veggies.
Excellent added 1/4 cup of red wine. Very easy and everyone loved it.

I put three roasts in instapot a d slow cooked on low for about ten hours and the on keep warm until morning. I tripled the recipe as best I could. I used a can of cream of celery and a can of cream of chicken. I didn't have dry onion mix but had a packet of a dip that you buy at art fairs that appeared to be similar. The gravy is very nice. Packaged it up in four separate containers for freezer for future meals. (someone left the freezer door open so had to cook a lot of meat)

This review is for me to refer to to see what works and doesn't for next time I want to make it. Those that get mad for not following the recipe need not read this one.
Eliminated the garlic salt and put in 1.5 cloves of garlic and 1/2 cup of red wine. Delicious

Made this following the recipe exactly and was surprisingly wowed! I actually did not find this to be too salty. Forms a tasty gravy that even thickens all on its own. I piled potatoes and carrots on top so that they wouldn’t get to overcooked. I was VERY surprised at how moist this stayed. That’s rare for venison since it is lacking fat. It’s a keeper
I made this yesterday, loved it. My wife and youngest though felt it was very similar to a beef roast......I disagree :)

I've made this twice. I liked it enough to eat it for an entire week (with adaptations). Definitely take the advice of others to reduce the salt. I recommend low sodium condensed mushroom soup. I'm looking to elevate this recipe with an additional flavour/spice. This is a great starter recipe though.
I think I had too much season for the small piece of meat I used. I am going to try again and use a larger piece.

used more "real"garlic, not salt, came out good, and tender. 
make again
Great recipe! Thanks for sharing
Instead of using garlic salt I used minced garlic. I also put celery and carrots in bottom of crock pot. My husband loves it!
Kids loved it and ate every bit. I added some beef stock to the slow cooker. I think a little rutabaga and or parsnips would work well with it too.

a little salty but i think I put a little too much garlic salt, and the soup mix was probably salty, but overall it tasted very good...would definitely use cubed meat as opposed to boned meat as it was more tender...was wondering what red wine might do for it

a little salty but i think I put a little too much garlic salt, and the soup mix was probably salty, but overall it tasted very good...would definitely use cubed meat as opposed to boned meat as it was more tender...was wondering what red wine might do for it
I did a little water as someone else suggested and did use minced garlic instead of garlic salt. delicious and easy to make

Easy to follow recipe with really really good results! I only remember cooking venison for my husband one other time and it didn't turn out nearly this good. A few ingredients make this crock pot ready in minimal time, and the taste is suble and delicious!
Soo good. I added 2 cans of mushroom soup and 3 cups of water for the carrots, potatoes and onions I put in. Definitely a wonderful receipe.
I added mustard, sriracha sauce, a touch of cooking sherry and two cups of diced butternut squash to make the gravy.
I made this but changed the broth. I added 2 cups of red wine and 7 cups of water. It was great. However, next time, I may cut down the wine by half cup.

Not bad. Went off everyone’s suggestions about the salt. Used garlic powder, a splash of soy sauce, mixed water into the soups and cubes up potatoes and threw around the roast while it cooked. It definitely did not have a strong salt flavor. However, the sauce did not go well with the venison roast but it didn’t make the potatoes taste good.
I did not change anything , other than doubling the pepper. Next time, I'd add 2 cups of rinsed white rice, another can of soup, a cup of beef broth and 3T cooking sherry. Very good flavor.

Shoe leather. Whoever said to cook it for six hours needs to explain how they keep it from getting so tough as to be inedible. I had to throw out two perfectly good sirloin roasts. Smelled good, though. Identify the internal temperature it should reach. Time in crockpot or oven are meaningless when compared with internal temperature as an indicator of doneness.

I would make this again, but I should have read the reviews beforehand. This was a salt lick and my family uses a lot of salt. I used garlic powder instead of garlic salt (and only half of what was called for), used a little red wine mixed with the soup mixture, but it was still too salty. I added carrots and celery with the onions, served over mashed potatoes. It would have been pretty boring without the added vegetables and I think next time I would add mushrooms as well.
WAY too salty. Inedible. Wish I read the reviews first.
Since the previous reviews said it was very salty, I skipped the garlic salt and used garlic powder instead. Delicious!
This is very good, but was way too salty. I won’t be adding the tablespoon of garlic salt next time. You don’t need it if using a whole pack of onion soup mix.
it was horrible way to gamey for me
I used Dreginek’s suggestion. This was amazing. The meat was nice and tender and the vegetables were tender but not mushy. This is a keeper for sure
This was wonderful full of flavor. We used fresh 3-4 garlic cloves instead of the garlic salt.
This is a great recipe!

This is a good basis. I used the soup and soup mix combo mixed with a cup of red wine and a cup of beef stock. I used minced garlic instead of garlic salt and added baby carrots celery and mushrooms to the slow cooker. The most important steps precede the slow cooker. I soaked the venison in milk for 24 hours (to reduce the gaminess) then seasoned and floured it and browned it in s frying pan to seal in the juices.
Way too salty.
It was ok. I like flavor everything tasted the same.
This recipe turned out amazing!
This was tasty and easy. I used small gold potatoes. I will just use more veggies next time because despite using the size roast requested we ran out of veggies before we did roast.

I changed a few spices
Very good roast
Only thing I did different is I used 1 Tbs chopped garlic instead of garlic salt, and, I added 1 cup red wine. I'm rather surprised how well this turned out.

The venison was tender and not at all gamey. I added potatoes to the recipe and skipped the cream soup as I needed to keep it dairy free. I used a bit of flour to thicken the juices in a separate pan then added that back to the stew. So, not quite the same recipe, but it was very good!
I tweeted it a bit on fluids and added potatoes and veggies but the foundation from this receipt wss great!

I read some of the reviews first and followed the recipe with some adjustments. Instead of garlic salt I used garlic powder. I also added about a cup of California red wine. AMAZING. It still tastes like venison but in such a comforting way. I will not try any other recipe. There are no leftovers tonight!!!
Very good, would recommend

I added water to mine and threw in carrots and taters, I had already marinated mine with some Beef Stubbs marinade. The cream of mushroom and onion mix was great and one that I would not have tried till I read your recipe. Thank you Sal.
Wonderful results with lots of nice sauce that came out not as heavy as I anticipated. Best part was that it was easy to prep the night before for hubby to put on at noon!
Super great recipe. Easy and the best venison roast I ever ever ate. I didn't deviate from it at all.

I wasn't sure how to rate this recipe because I think it needs some tweaking as written, but it deserves five stars with those tweaks. First, I cut back on the amount of fresh onion since the recipe also calls for onion soup mix. One large onion is equivalent to 1-1/2 c. chopped, but I used about 1/2 c. Second, as mentioned by several other reviewers, 1 T soy sauce + 1 T. garlic salt + 1 package of onion soup mix = way too much salt. I substituted a couple teaspoons of minced garlic for the garlic salt. Third, I added vegetables (baby potatoes, carrots, and celery) and liquid (1 c. broth + 1/2 c. red wine). Then, near the end of the cooking time, I added a slurry of potato starch and milk and turned the heat to high to thicken the stew before serving. We enjoyed it over rice.
Great! Tastes like beef!

I added quartered potatoes, carrots and celery. Used garlic powder instead of garlic salt. Cooked on high for 4 hours. I removed the potatoes and mashed them with butter. Served it with the gravy on everything! Rated it a 4 because I don't like deer meat and I could still slightly taste the game but I think this is the closest I have come to enjoying it!
Basic, but good. Maybe a little salty for how we try to eat, but that's to be expected from the soup mix.
Added half cup of beef broth. Also potatoes and carrots final two hours. Very tender. Will make again.
Great recipe. I added about a cup of diced tomatoes and a tsp or so of real garlic instead of garlic salt. The sauce works well with white rice as a side.
I followed the instructions exactly. My husband LOVED IT! Thank you for another great recipe.
Our family loved this! I had to sub a French onion soup for the dry mix, but still great!!!

Best venison recipe I have ever tried!!! I read the review and eliminated the soya sauce and added a dash (or 3) of red wine near the end. It didn't taste gamey at all.... if you didn't know you would think its beef. It was even better the next day!
I was pressed for time so I modified slightly: I cubed my roast and set the slow-cooker on high for 4 hrs. Put over brown and wild rice. This was tremendous.
My husband said it was the best roast he has ever eaten. We've been married 48 years, so we have had many roasts! We'll definitely have this one again.
Next time I make it there will be a lot less salt in the recipe. Otherwise it was very tasty.
I followed the reviews of others to avoid saltiness, and it turned out great! I will be making this again. We had friends over, they thought it was beef!

It's still cooking so I'll be back to finish the review, however I added 1 pound of carrots, 2 large baking potatoes, 1/3 cup red wine, 1/3 cup basalmic vinegar, and 1/3 cup water. Thought it was a bit dry on its own as written. 

We will see! Very much looking forward to seeing how he turns out! 

Great super easy receipe.

The reviews are totally right, it does not have a gamey flavor at all! I added all elements to this recipe that were stated (applying soy sauce and worstershire more liberally) and also added potatoes, baby carrots, chopped celery and fresh mushrooms! Definitely making this again in the future!

Excellent dish! I did make a few changes (naturally!) as I did not have the packet onion soup mix so substituted onion/garlic salt and herbs. I also sloshed browned the meat first and then deglazed the pan with some red wine.
Amazing so tasty and tender. Kids loved it.
I made no changes and I will be making it again. Next time I will be inviting friends for dinner. It was great and very easy.
the meal itself was amazing better then any deer roast i have ever had. Only thing i recommend is to add potatoes and carrots.
I did the changes like many others of half the packet of onion mix, 1 cup red wine and lots of veges (potatoes and carrots) and it came out awesome!!
With the exception of using homemade cream of mushroom soup I followed this recipe exactly. My venison would easily pass for lean beef as it had no detectable games taste. Fantastic recipe!
DELICIOUS COMMENTS AND NO ONE KNEW IT WAS VENISON.
Outstanding recipe. Made this along with a turkey for Thanksgiving. Everybody loved it. Made it with an Elk roast. Very tender and tasty. Used fresh minced garlic instead of the salt.
This soup is pretty bland. Not really sure what it needs to improve the taste..will find a different recipe next time.
I love venison stew, though I always add along with my vegetables, a banana pepper or two. Gives it an awesome flavor!
A little salty but still good
Made this a couple times for my husband and picky daughter. They rave about the flavor, especially the gravy. Definitely a keeper!

I think this was a great, fast and easy recipe. Although we are not a family that uses salt...at all. So I have had onion soup before...so with the onion soup and mushroom soup I thought that was enough sodium. So I did not use garlic salt instead opted for just garlic powder. I also added a little salt free steak seasoning. But overall a great recipe!!

Used venison but I would make this with any beef roast tool Very good!! The gravy was dark and very tasty. New favorite over just the Onion soup package and the Cream of Onion soup can. The extra ingredients really bummed it up a notch. New favorite for sure! Thanks
I have made this recipe. it is fantastic!!!!

This was my first time cooking with venison so I was a little nervous but it turned out great!! Super easy too. Did tweak the recipe slightly. Left out the soy sauce, added a little beef broth, carrots, peas, red potatoes, and some flour in the last 30 mins of cooking to thicken it. Served with biscuits. SO good! Will definitely make again.

This was my first time cooking venison and I was very nervous about - but it turned out great! Yes, it was a little bit salty for my liking, but it was still yummy! Next time I'll cut back on the dry soup mix. I poured some of the "gravy" over mashed potatoes and sautéed mushrooms. I will definitely use this recipe again!

Also did the 1-1/2 cups extra water with the onion soup mix to reduce salt and it turned out amazing. also added carrots, peas, Potatos chopped up with skin on, corn, celery, Lima beans and green beans and it comes out WoW!!! Highly recommend to cook this.

Followed the advice of others: halved the onion soup mix, used fresh garlic instead of garlic salt. I did add 1 1/2C low sodium beef broth, potatoes, & carrots since I was working with venison cubes. This made a real good stew!
